author: Daniel Greene
description:
Authors are being squeezed—and a major new interview reveals just how bad it might be. Here is Robin's petition: https://chng.it/mdgp8mZffb 

I spoke with Robin Sullivan about the ongoing Audible situation, and she shares details that may implicate Audible in paying themselves from author credits—effectively taking money directly out of indie authors’ pockets.

We cover:

Audible announced 50%/30% royalties, but many authors are now getting as little as $1 per credit.

Market control: With Audible controlling over 60% of audiobook sales, these practices hit indie writers and trad authors.

Why you should care: This isn’t just an author problem—it’s about transparency, fair pay, and the future of publishing.

If you value your audiobooks, now’s the time to get informed and speak up.

Share this video with fellow authors, narrators, and audiobook fans.

Tell me in the comments: Do you believe Audible’s royalty system is fair?

Support My Work & Books:
Breach of Peace: https://tinyurl.co
title: Audible Is Broken
